LostDogsNewJersey.description:
This article backs up our recommendation to NOT offer a reward online for your missing pet.  In addition, we want to remind you that you do not need to pay any website or service to list your missing pet.  There are many, many FREE services like HelpingLostPets.com that will list your pet for FREE. And we are also partnered with many amazing volunteer groups across the country.

https://www.timeslive.co.za/news/south-africa/2017-10-16-beware-social-media-scammers-when-posting-a-reward-for-lost-pets/

*******Still Missing as of 10/19*****

Please spread the word! Betty was LOST on October 02, 2017 in West Orange, NJ 07052 near Near Manger Rd & Lorelei Rd

Message from Owner: Betty has been missig since 10/02 from West Orange. She is wearing a pink collar with tags. She may have a retractable leash attached. She is also microchipped. Please be on the lookout for her. She is friendly but very scared and a runner. Do not chase

Description: Black lab with white patch on chest. Very scared. Do not chase

For more info or to contact Betty's owner, click here: https://www.pawboost.com/p/4775105

***Re-Post - STILL MISSING AS OF Oct 19, 2017***
Found Dachshund in Ledgewood, NJ US (07852). Lost and found dogs in the US, Canada, and UK.

TIP: DISTRIBUTING FLYERS AT COMMUNITY EVENTS

Fall is a great time for community events such as fall festivals. What better place to reach a large number of the members of your community and get the word out about your missing pet. When distributing flyers, use the FREE flyer templates from our site to increase awareness about your missing pet and about HelpingLostPets.com and Lost Dogs Georgia. This helps other pets in your community get back home.

We offer several different templates to choose from. 

Template #1 - With TearOffs
Template #2 - Photo with detailed information
Template #3 - With large photo
Template #4 - Large photo

All templates allow you to select the 4-on-a-sheet printing option to cut and hand out. This is a great way to cut down on printing cost and get your flyer out to the public.

To list a lost or found pet and get a post on our page or the Lost Cats Georgia page and to get your FREE flyer, go to:

www.HelpingLostPets.com/PET

To see all our templates, go to: http://www.lostdogsgeorgia.org/tips-for-listing.html

The dog in this photo is Buster Sey Moore. He's missing from Covington, Georgia and is just one of the many lost dogs listed with us. We would love to help him and all the pets listed with us get back home.
Closest Intersection: RT 3 EAST Near the Lyndhurst exit. He has a nice leather collar on, no tags, seems very cared for. Super friendly. He was running up to every car to try to get in it for help.

CUTIE HAS BEEN MISSING FOR OVER A YEAR - PLEASE LIKE AND SHARE HIS FLYER TO GET THE FAMILY SOME ANSWERS #CUTIE (m) #Schenectady (Exit 26 on the Thruway)  #Schenectady Co. #Lost #Dog Male #AustralianCattleDog Blue / White / Black/His tongue hangs out of his mouth
CONTACT Phone: (518) 522-6662
More Info, Photos and to Contact: http://www.helpinglostpets.com/petdetail/?id=1335842

REUNITED!!! 

Great Meadoes / allamuchy NJ. Lost dog 

MISSING: Wanda

Our girl Wanda wandered off yesterday in the Great Meadows/Allamuchy area. She is almost 15 years old and is very sweet. Please repost so we can bring her home.

$200 Reward

If you know of any web sites or Facebook sites that pick up lost or stray dogs please let us know

LostDogsMichigan.description:
This article backs up our recommendation to NOT offer a reward online for your missing pet.  In addition, we want to remind you that you do not need to pay any website or service to list your missing pet.  There are many, many FREE services like HelpingLostPets.com that will list your pet for FREE. And we are also partnered with many amazing volunteer groups across the country.

https://www.timeslive.co.za/news/south-africa/2017-10-16-beware-social-media-scammers-when-posting-a-reward-for-lost-pets/

We meet people every day that would climb a mountain to find their missing pet. This is why we are so driven to get EVERY LOST AND FOUND PET LISTED ON ONE Database.

We have partnered with so many amazing volunteer groups that are helping across the country. In addition, our Matchmakers group is growing. 

If you have a missing pet and you have not listed with us, you can list for free, The next Match made might be for your pet. Please use this link to list: http://www.HelpinglostPets.com/PET

Are you someone that likes to match lost and found pets? Join our Matchmakers group and we will teach you how to use HelpingLostPets.com. Just email us at info@helpinglostpets.com

This article collaborates why Lost Dogs Illinois does not recommend posting rewards.
"According to the Better Business Bureau‚ based in the United States‚ more pet owners are being scammed out of rewards due to the increasing "missing cats and dogs posts" on social media. In a statement last month‚ the bureau description of the scam mirrored Sharp's experience.

"Although you may be tempted to do anything to see your dog or cat returned safely‚ don't pay up! The scammer doesn't have your pet. They will just take the money and disappear.""
https://www.timeslive.co.za/news/south-africa/2017-10-16-beware-social-media-scammers-when-posting-a-reward-for-lost-pets/

Hunting season is here! Remember to print out flyers and distribute them at local hunting areas.
Create your FREE flyer at www.www.HelpingLostPets.com/LDIL then visit our website at www.lostdogsillinois.org for more tips to help you find your missing dog.

It was a match!!!

A dog picked up from Walton County Animal Control and her listing uploaded to helpinglostpets.com and shared to the public. An owner filing a lost report with the shelter via the helpinglostpets.com system and the same alert going out to the public. This is what a match looks like with helpinglostpets.com and this system helped Hartley get home today!

Thank you to everyone who shared and to Walton County Animal Control for their continued use of the program! ONE central database for lost and found pets does get more pets home!

To learn more about helpinglostpets.com and to see how it can help your shelter, please watch this video from Walton County Animal Control on all the benefits of HeLP.

https://www.youtube.com/embed/BHNO0OO3OVE

To add your shelter today, go to: www.HelpingLostPets.com/ORG

You know we love a good microchip story!  Oreo came in as a stray 10 year old cat to SSHS.  He was microchipped and we tracked the owner to Arizona.  Turns out that his owners divorced and Oreo ended up with the ex-husband in Chicago.  However, he was given away and then got lost.  When we talked to his original mom in AZ, she moved heaven and earth to get him back and called her friend, Paul, who is a Captain with Southwest Airlines.  Paul met staff at Midway tonight and Oreo is flying home to his mom in AZ!
A lost Door County pet is back with its family after it was found miles away in another county, officials said.

A special 2-part #FiveSibes #TheSibeVibe #LostDog series on @DogWorksRadio:  "Help me! I'm Lost! - What To Do If You've Lost or Found a Dog" hosted by Hudson Valley's award-winning author DOROTHY WILLS-RAFTERY featuring guests KATHY POBLOSKIE, director and co-founder of Lost Dogs of Wisconsin (LDoW) & co-founder of Lost Dogs of America and BARB MCDONALD, volunteer at LDoW and admin of Lost/found Husky Dogs. 

To listen to PART 1, visit: http://dogworksradio.com/the-sibe-vibe-what-if-you-have-lost-or-found-a-dog/

To listen to PART 2, visit:  http://dogworksradio.com/what-if-you-have-lost-or-found-a-dog-part-2/  

Please subscribe to Dog Works Radio on iTunes to hear all the shows, including "The Sibe Vibe!"

Pete Mayher lost his yellow labrador, Wizzer, five years ago on Fort Myers Beach. Over the years, hope for finding him waned, until three weeks ago, when Hurricane Irma ripped through Florida.

On today's date Officers responded to a report of a prowler on Dorothy Drive. Upon there arrival Officers located the pictured suspect wandering the area. He complied with verbal commands and was taken into custody without incident. He is currently in need of bail and is looking for his guardian's assistance. If you know who his guardians are or have identifying information please contact us.

***Owner located 10/12/17 1949***
Do you know me? I was found on Rt 4a in Springfield this afternoon. Please contact the Springfield,NH Police Department at (603) 863-3232.

Volunteers are the heart and backbone of Lost Dogs of America. Volunteer opportunities are available around the nation and we welcome you to fill out an application form from the following link. 

Do you want to help animals but can’t get to your local shelter to volunteer? Join us in the Back Home Revolution! Every lost dog that gets back home, frees up shelter space for needier animals. 

This is a rewarding position which can be done from the comfort of your home. We can accommodate your schedule with flexible hours. Training is provided. Once you have filled out the following application you will be contacted with more information. Thank you for your interest!

http://lostdogsofamerica.org/volunteer-signup

Home at Last!  After almost FIVE MONTHS and travel across THREE STATES, Cody, the German Shepherd from #Phoenix #MaricopaCo, is back home!  His family has been constantly and diligently search for their dog.  They never gave up!  They made sure his chip information was up to date.  They posted everywhere.  They checked the shelters.  They even used a drone to canvas the neighborhood.  Five months later, they got a call from someone near San Antonio, Texas, almost 1000 miles away!  The couple who found him runs an animal rescue on their property (including Zebras, Camels, etc.) so they obviously have a soft spot for animals in need.  They saw Cody dodging traffic on an interstate, stopped and called him.  He came right to them.  They got him all cleaned up, contacted their vet, took him in and found a microchip!  He is now back in Arizona and home!  We understand he immediately went to his toy when he got home.  From Cody's owner, " It's a great ending to a very sad and trying few months.  I'm just so happy and pleased that there are wonderful people who found a beautiful dog and did the right thing. Thank you for your care and concern for the lost and the families in need."  Missing 5-17-2017.  Back home 10-4-2017.  Welcome home Cody!

***Owner located, thanks to all for your help 16:26 10/12/17***
Pet found in the area of 100 South Road this morning. No Tags, but she is wearing a wide pink collar.Please call the Canaan Police if she is your pet or if you recognize her so she can be returned ASAP.
